abstracts.cdata!:
This Result Profile talks about
            promoting an inclusive, equitable and efficient social
            protection system in Colombia. There were several challenges
            that remained in Colombia, especially in terms of the
            limited coverage of the pension and health systems, and
            unemployment insurance, which were available mostly to
            formal workers. Similarly, programs aimed at fostering
            employability, such as training, labor intermediation, and
            other employment services, were not reaching the lower
            segments of the population. A critical challenge was to
            enhance the coordination between these programs.
            International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)
            supported Colombia in the implementation of the reforms. In
            parallel to this operation, the Bank also provided
            complementary technical assistance in the form of seminars,
            policy notes, short technical briefs, as well as direct
            comments and suggestions for the technical aspects of some
            of the regulation and policy design in social protection
            areas. Improvements in social sector management benefited
            all citizens through more efficient and transparent central
            administration, through better access to public service
            delivery, and through better quality and access to public information.
